text:
plunging  ore-shoots  along  the  Central  BIF  and  further  drilling  is  warranted  to  test  these 
 Exploration by Yilgarn since acquiring the tenement has comprised the acquisition of detailed 
 aeromagnetics  over  the  property,  image  processing,  geological  interpretation  and  reverse 
 circulation drilling, consisting of 27 holes for a total of 1845m.  Drilling tested the footwall, 
 central and hanging wall BIF units and a coincident soil anomaly/magnetic feature to the west 
 Drilling  beneath  the  soil  anomaly  intersected  broad  zones  of  anomalous  gold  mineralisation 
 (~0.5  g/t  Au)  associated  with  weak  quartz-pyrite  alteration  within  sheared  mafic  rocks  and 
 warrants follow-up drilling.  
 Limited field work was carried in the past year, with efforts concentrated on the re-assessment 
 of the previous year’s drilling results in light of the recent substantial increase in the gold price 
 to over $800/oz.  An earlier assessment had indicated that a sale or farm-out to Sons of Gwalia 
 (operators of the adjacent Deep South Deposit and the proximal Carosue treatment plant) was 
 an option, but the collapse of Sons of Gwalia in late 2004 put any discussions on hold.  Those 
 assets have subsequently been purchased by Saracen Gold and Saracen is currently evaluating 
 the  re-commencement  of  mining  operations  in  the  area.    Yilgarn  is  currently  holding 
 discussions with Saracen regarding possible collaborative development of the established Deep 
 Well gold resource.

text:
Red Back Mining NL in December 2003. 
 The lease lies immediately to the north and along strike from the Deep South Prospect, 
 for  which  Sons  of  Gwalia  Limited  released  an  inferred  resource  estimate  of  1.5 Mt 
 grading  4.0  ppm  Au  containing  200  000  ounces  of  gold.    Mining  of  this  deposit 
 commenced in 2004 but has now ceased.

text:
1. 1  Location and Access 
 The  Deep  Well  project  is  located  about  175  kilometres  northeast  of  Kalgoorlie 
 and about 100 kilometres south of Laverton (Figure 2).  It is within the Mount 
 Margaret Mineral Field and occurs on the Edjudina 1:250,000 scale (sheet SH51-
 06) and Yabboo 1:100,000 scale (sheet 3438) map sheets.  The area straddles the 
 boundary  of  the  Mt  Celia  and  Edjudina  Pastoral  Stations,  within  the  Leonora 
 Shire. 
 Access to the project from Kalgoorlie is via the Yarri Road, past the old Porphyry 
 and  Edjudina  Mining  Centres,  crossing  over  Lake  Raeside  and  then  a  further 
 20km  north  along  the  Mt  Celia  Road.    This  is  generally  an  all  weather  route, 
 except after exceptionally heavy rainfall when the Lake Raeside crossing can be 
 under water.  From Laverton, the project is accessed via the Mt Weld Road south 
 to the Lake Carey Causeway, thence proceeding south to join the Mt Celia Road.  
 Low lying areas immediately east of Lake Carey are frequently prone to flooding, 
 making this route untrafficable after heavy rain. 
 Tenure 
 Mining  Lease  M39/129,  covering  an  area  of  120  ha,  was  granted  to  Picon 
 Explorations Pty Ltd (75%) and Porphyry (1939) Gold Mines NL (25%) on May 
 6 1988 and subsequently transferred to Red Back Mining NL in April 1997.  In 
 December 2003, Yilgarn purchased the lease from Red Back, with the transfers 
 effected in 2005. 
 Exploration is managed by Yilgarn Mining (WA) Pty Ltd.

31.text: Bedrock  geology  within the project area is poorly  exposed but comprises three

32.text: distinct  BIF  horizons  within  a  sequence  of  mainly  felsic  volcaniclastic  rocks,

33.text: intruded by gabbro and dacitic porphyry.  The central BIF has been intermittently

34.text: prospected over its entire length (within the lease) and almost all post 1980 gold

35.text: exploration within the lease has been concentrated on this unit.  Mineralisation is

36.text: associated with the oxidised portion of a sulphide facies BIF and appears to be

37.text: more strongly developed along a subtle flexure in the BIF (Burrows, 1988).  In

38.text: drilling,  the  immediate  hanging  wall  to  the  mineralised  BIF  is  commonly

39.text: interpreted as metamorphosed high Mg basalt whereas the footwall varies from

40.text: basalt, ultramafic, biotite schist, dolerite and dacitic porphyry (Burrows, 1988).

42.text: The  eastern  BIF  is  predominantly  a  surface  silicified  pyritic  black  shale/chert

43.text: unit,  becoming  more  magnetite-rich  in  the  south.    Extensive  massive  quartz

44.text: veining is spatially associated with this horizon in the northern parts of the lease.

45.text: The  western  BIF  is  known  from  magnetics  and  drilling  and  comprises  a

text:
Bedrock  geology  within the project area is poorly  exposed but comprises three 
 that  are  continuous  over 
 apparently  comagmatic  dolerite/gabbro  bodies 
 distinct  BIF  horizons  within  a  sequence  of  mainly  felsic  volcaniclastic  rocks, 
 intruded by gabbro and dacitic porphyry.  The central BIF has been intermittently 
 prospected over its entire length (within the lease) and almost all post 1980 gold 
 exploration within the lease has been concentrated on this unit.  Mineralisation is 
 associated with the oxidised portion of a sulphide facies BIF and appears to be 
 more strongly developed along a subtle flexure in the BIF (Burrows, 1988).  In 
 drilling,  the  immediate  hanging  wall  to  the  mineralised  BIF  is  commonly 
 interpreted as metamorphosed high Mg basalt whereas the footwall varies from 
 basalt, ultramafic, biotite schist, dolerite and dacitic porphyry (Burrows, 1988). 
 The  eastern  BIF  is  predominantly  a  surface  silicified  pyritic  black  shale/chert 
 unit,  becoming  more  magnetite-rich  in  the  south.    Extensive  massive  quartz 
 veining is spatially associated with this horizon in the northern parts of the lease.  
 The  western  BIF  is  known  from  magnetics  and  drilling  and  comprises  a

9.text: From 1984 to 1987, Picon Exploration Pty Ltd and Porphyry Gold Mines NL drilled 62

10.text: shallow RC holes totalling 1998m at Deep Well, including a programme of detailed 10m

11.text: by  5m  spaced  delineation  drilling  over  a  60m  strike  length.    Significant  intersections

12.text: reported from this drilling, all associated with the main BIF unit, included 6m grading

13.text: 9.5 gpt Au and 8m grading 5.7 gpt Au.  Twelve reconnaissance holes drilled at variable

14.text: spacing over the northern extension of the BIF also returned encouraging results.

text:
From 1984 to 1987, Picon Exploration Pty Ltd and Porphyry Gold Mines NL drilled 62 
 shallow RC holes totalling 1998m at Deep Well, including a programme of detailed 10m 
 by  5m  spaced  delineation  drilling  over  a  60m  strike  length.    Significant  intersections 
 reported from this drilling, all associated with the main BIF unit, included 6m grading 
 9.5 gpt Au and 8m grading 5.7 gpt Au.  Twelve reconnaissance holes drilled at variable 
 spacing over the northern extension of the BIF also returned encouraging results.

20.text: length  down  to  a  maximum  depth  of  30m  (for  a  significant  portion  of  this  zone,  the

21.text: resource  was  only  determined  to  15m  and  mineralisation  remained  open  below  this

24.text: Exploration  by  Red  Back  Mining  NL  in  1996-97  comprised  a  programme  of  surface

25.text: geochemistry and 12 deep RC holes (1080m) to test a number of targets along the central

26.text: BIF and a strong magnetic anomaly immediately west of the central BIF.  Drilling along

27.text: the central BIF intersected anomalous mineralisation in all holes, with a best result of 5m

28.text: at  2.8  gpt  Au  from  below  the  Deep  Well  resource,  confirming  continuity  of

29.text: mineralisation  in  the  primary  zone.    Of  potentially  greater  significance  are  the  results

30.text: from the two holes drilled to test a magnetic feature to the west of the central BIF.  Hole

31.text: DWRC6  intersected  2m  @  6.3  gpt  Au  and  DWRC8  (130m  to  the  north)  2m  @

32.text: 1.4 gpt Au, both holes associated with a sheared mafic – BIF contact.  This horizon has

33.text: not been tested by any other drilling.  Following the drilling, Red Back carried out a soil

34.text: sampling  programme  at  80m  by  40m  spacing  over  the  entire  lease.    Results  from  the

35.text: survey  clearly  define  the  known  mineralisation  associated  with  the  central  BIF  with

36.text: values of 99, 86 and 45 ppb Au in three separate zones.  However the highest gold assay

37.text: returned was 210 ppb Au from 150m to the west of this line in the northern part of the

38.text: lease.  This discrete anomaly, which was confirmed by infill sampling with a result of

39.text: 150 ppb Au, has been defined over a strike length of about 200m and appears to be along

40.text: strike  from  the  magnetic  feature  300m  to  the  south  tested  by  holes  DWRC6  and

41.text: DWRC8.  The peak of the soil anomaly is in an area of subcrop and residual regolith,

42.text: becoming  progressively  more  soil  covered  to  the  south.    Four  of  13  surface  rock  chip

43.text: samples collected from around the peak soil anomaly returned greater than 0.1 ppm Au,

44.text: with a best result of 1.1 gpt Au from weathered chlorite-biotite schist.

46.text: Exploration by Yilgarn since assuming management of the Project has comprised digital

47.text: capture  of  historic  data,  the  acquisition  of  detailed  aeromagnetics  over  the  property,

48.text: image processing, re-establishment of the old grid, geological interpretation and reverse

49.text: circulation  drilling,  consisting  of  27  holes  for  a  total  of  1845m.    Drilling  tested  the

50.text: footwall,  central  and  hanging  wall  BIF  units  and  a  coincident  soil  anomaly/magnetic

51.text: feature to the west of the BIF.

text:
portion  of  the  mineralised  zone,  located  near  the  southern  end  of  the  lease.    The 
 syndicate  determined  a  shallow  measured  and  indicated  resource  over  a  190m  strike 
 length  down  to  a  maximum  depth  of  30m  (for  a  significant  portion  of  this  zone,  the 
 resource  was  only  determined  to  15m  and  mineralisation  remained  open  below  this 
 Exploration  by  Red  Back  Mining  NL  in  1996-97  comprised  a  programme  of  surface 
 geochemistry and 12 deep RC holes (1080m) to test a number of targets along the central 
 BIF and a strong magnetic anomaly immediately west of the central BIF.  Drilling along 
 the central BIF intersected anomalous mineralisation in all holes, with a best result of 5m 
 at  2.8  gpt  Au  from  below  the  Deep  Well  resource,  confirming  continuity  of 
 mineralisation  in  the  primary  zone.    Of  potentially  greater  significance  are  the  results 
 from the two holes drilled to test a magnetic feature to the west of the central BIF.  Hole 
 DWRC6  intersected  2m  @  6.3  gpt  Au  and  DWRC8  (130m  to  the  north)  2m  @ 
 1.4 gpt Au, both holes associated with a sheared mafic – BIF contact.  This horizon has 
 not been tested by any other drilling.  Following the drilling, Red Back carried out a soil 
 sampling  programme  at  80m  by  40m  spacing  over  the  entire  lease.    Results  from  the 
 survey  clearly  define  the  known  mineralisation  associated  with  the  central  BIF  with 
 values of 99, 86 and 45 ppb Au in three separate zones.  However the highest gold assay 
 returned was 210 ppb Au from 150m to the west of this line in the northern part of the 
 lease.  This discrete anomaly, which was confirmed by infill sampling with a result of 
 150 ppb Au, has been defined over a strike length of about 200m and appears to be along 
 strike  from  the  magnetic  feature  300m  to  the  south  tested  by  holes  DWRC6  and 
 DWRC8.  The peak of the soil anomaly is in an area of subcrop and residual regolith, 
 becoming  progressively  more  soil  covered  to  the  south.    Four  of  13  surface  rock  chip 
 samples collected from around the peak soil anomaly returned greater than 0.1 ppm Au, 
 with a best result of 1.1 gpt Au from weathered chlorite-biotite schist. 
 Exploration by Yilgarn since assuming management of the Project has comprised digital 
 capture  of  historic  data,  the  acquisition  of  detailed  aeromagnetics  over  the  property, 
 image processing, re-establishment of the old grid, geological interpretation and reverse 
 circulation  drilling,  consisting  of  27  holes  for  a  total  of  1845m.    Drilling  tested  the 
 footwall,  central  and  hanging  wall  BIF  units  and  a  coincident  soil  anomaly/magnetic 
 feature to the west of the BIF.

9.text: drilling is warranted to test these positions.

16.text: grading  4.0  gpt  Au  from  the  northern-most  shoot  only,  with  high-grade  intercepts

17.text: including 12m @10.6 gpt Au, 12m @ 7.0 gpt Au and 4m @14.6 gpt Au reported from

18.text: outside the resource area.  The high sulphide content of the mineralisation allowed Sons

19.text: of  Gwalia  to  successfully  employ  geophysical  methods  in  targeting  blind  mineralised

text:
southerly plunging ore-shoots along the Central BIF.  Further drilling involving deep RC 
 drilling is warranted to test these positions. 
 Exploration by Sons of Gwalia immediately south of the lease has identified high-grade 
 mineralisation  at  the  Deep  South  and  Mexico  prospects.    Mineralisation  is  associated 
 with  sulphidic  quartz  veins  forming  three  steeply  north  plunging  shoots  within  a  well 
 defined  carbonate-sulphide  altered  shear  zone.    Each  shoot  has  a  strike  length  of  only 
 100 - 200m.    Sons  of  Gwalia  have  reported  an  inferred  resource  of  1 500 000  tonnes 
 grading  4.0  gpt  Au  from  the  northern-most  shoot  only,  with  high-grade  intercepts 
 including 12m @10.6 gpt Au, 12m @ 7.0 gpt Au and 4m @14.6 gpt Au reported from 
 outside the resource area.  The high sulphide content of the mineralisation allowed Sons 
 of  Gwalia  to  successfully  employ  geophysical  methods  in  targeting  blind  mineralised 
 EXPLORATION CONDUCTED IN 2006/7 
 Limited  field  work  was  carried  out  in  the  past  year,  with  efforts  concentrated  on 
 continued assessment of the previous drilling results in light of the increase in the gold 
 price to around $800/oz.  An earlier assessment had indicated that a sale or farm-out to 
 Sons of Gwalia (operators of the adjacent Deep South Deposit) was an option, but the 
 collapse  of  Sons  of  Gwalia  in  late  2004  put  those  discussions  on  hold  until  the  assets 
 were dealt with by the Administrators of Sons of Gwalia.  Late in 2005 Saracen Gold 
 Mines  announced  that  it  had  agreed  to  purchase  the  Laverton  gold  assets  of  Sons  of 
 Gwalia, including the Carosue treatment plant and the Deep South deposit.  However, the 
 sale was not completed until 2006 and Saracen was not in a position to discuss possible 
 toll milling or other arrangements until after they had completed a review of their own 
 recently acquired assets, which continued through 2006.  Following completion of this 
 work by Saracen, Yilgarn is now holding discussions with Saracen regarding a possible 
 CONCLUSIONS AND RECOMMENDATIONS 
 Exploration  drilling  to  date  has  indicated  that  there  is  limited  potential  for  significant 
 oxide resources at shallow depth outside the known mineralised zone associated with the 
 Central  BIF  horizon.    Given  the  relatively  shallow  depth  of  the  existing  drilling,  the 
 exploration potential at depth greater than 100m is still largely unknown at the Central 
 BIF unit (only 7 holes have intersected the BIF between 50m and 150m below surface).  
 Detailed  study  of  the  drilling  to  date  has  also  indicated  the  possibility  for  multiple 
 stacked, shallow to moderately southerly plunging ore-shoots, at moderate depth along 
 the  Central  BIF.    Further  drilling  is  warranted  to  test  the  down-plunge  extensions  of 
 intersections in holes DWP051 (5m @ 3.1 g/t Au, DWRC02 (5m @ 2 g/t Au),.DWRC06 
 (2m @ 6.6 g/t Au), DWP037 (3m @ 4 g/t Au), and DWP063 (3m @ 4.5 g/t Au).

7.text: Yilgarn is currently holding discussions with Saracen Gold  (the holder of the adjacent

8.text: Deep  South  deposit  and  the  proximal  Carosue  treatment  plant)  regarding  possible

9.text: collaborative development of the established Deep Well gold resource.
